conclusion: The light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
The objects are fixed in position relative to each other and the ground.
If the light source moves forward, it will be closer to the objects and further from the ground.
As the light source moves forward, the angle of incidence of the light on the objects will change, affecting the direction and length of the shadows.
Shadow A, cast by the mushrooms, will become shorter and more concentrated as the light source moves forward.
Shadow B, cast by the rock, will become shorter and more concentrated as the light source moves forward.
Shadow C, cast by the white object, will become shorter and more concentrated as the light source moves forward.
Shadow D, cast by the book, will become shorter and more concentrated as the light source moves forward.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will become shorter and more concentrated as the light source moves forward.
